product_label: Spice Mobile: A Phrase Thesaurus & History of the English Language
teaser: Thesaurus meets writing generator
description: A new kind of thesaurus with over 23,000 fresh phrases (no clichés or idioms); Descriptive metaphors and similes; Detailed source history; Associative linking to similar phrases
pros: It can help get you going when you can't think of anything
cons: need to watch tutorial for best use of the product (5 min)
summary: Inspirational tool for writer's block

teaser: A mix of google drive and story book
description: Getting started on an essay, novel, or any form of writing may require some brainstorming. This website allows you to quickly and easily brainstorm or create a map for your ideas. This simple, easy-to-use site makes it painless to organize ideas with the use of customization of bubble color, text size and formatting, and even hyperlinks. This site is free to use, and you don’t even need to make an account unless you want to save your data.
pros: I think the amount of features is the best thing about the website
cons: It costs money and the website is not easy to navigate.
summary: It is the best combination of writing resources packed into one

teaser: Advice giver for aspiring writers
description: this app offers hundreds of insightful tips for anyone in publishing and for those who aspire to be.
pros: Laurie is a credible source that specializes in publishing.
cons: only for those serious about persuing career in writing or publishing
summary: nothing heavy - it's a good little "tip of the day" type of helper

teaser: Every significant speech you might want to hear
description: Speech Bank
pros: Many speeches can be heard via original recordings; very powerful
cons: system is a little "clunky"
summary: It takes a minute to learn the system, but then it's a gold mine

teaser: A store on your device
description: Find games, programs, books/magazines, music and more for use with your devices.
pros: Shop from the convenience of your device
cons: Be careful with items that cost money - be sure to read reviews first
summary: This should be one of the first things you learn to operate from your new device.

teaser: Free writing editor
description: Aztekera offers a free online tool that helps you look out for the ‘To be’ verbs, that make up a passive voice phrase. Use this tool to eliminate the passive voice phrases in your writing. The excessive use of passive voice might be the reason for the non-persuasive tone of your writing. Get rid of such form of writing using Aztekera Passive voice checker tool.
pros: Analyzes text for "to be" verbs
cons: It's difficult to understand results
summary: Idea is good; not very practical - find something else.

teaser: Like Duolingual but with more languages
description: App to learn languages
pros: Inexpensive online language-learning program. Good quality and course structure.
cons: Throws a lot of new words at beginners. Quantity of content varies by language. No live Web classes or tutoring.
summary: For an inexpensive program, it packs a punch, as material is challenging. Not for slackers

teaser: Writing platform that keeps you focused
description:
Traditional text processors include dozens of options for formatting text, distracting you from what really matters: writing.
Calmly Writer is an editor designed to focus on what you want to tell, with a simple, unobtrusive and ease-to-use user interface
pros: Focus on only the part you're writing on keeps those easily distracted on focus. Includes features that help people with disabilities or other focusing "issues."
cons: Minimal features (b/c you're not supposed to be distracted!)
summary: Calmly Writer is best used for writers who find themselves distracted in other applications. It can’t replace Google Docs or Microsoft Word. It's great for getting the creative juices flowing.

teaser: Its an online newspaper!
description: Its a free online newspaper that updates you on current events.
pros: an array of subjects to read about
cons: its not super popular and focuses on a lot more local news
summary: Its important to keep yourself updated on current events

teaser: different easybib
description: Citation Machine automatically generates citations in MLA, APA, Chicago, Turabian, and thousands more!
pros: easy to MLA cite sources
cons: none?
summary: easy MLA citations

teaser: Mind Mapping for Groups
description: A clear way to share complex information.
pros: It helps your thoughts be super organized
cons: It costs money for the good features
summary: Mind Mapping: With Friends!

teaser: Book social media
description:
Creative Book Builder is a fantastic app that allows students to create books in epub format, which can then be exported to iBooks and shared with others. There are a variety of instructional uses for this app, from using it as a publishing tool for project-based learning to a summative assessment at the end of a unit.  Students can embed images, audio files, video files, and write text.  The advantage of an epub document over a PDF document is that all of the media will be preserved and available for readers to interact with when the final product is published.  

Depending on how you use Creative Book Builder with students, this app can help students complete tasks that align with every level of the revised Bloom's Taxonomy.  Explore the different ways this app can be used at each level of Bloom's Taxonomy...
pros: Books written can be shared
cons: Seems to be for younger children
summary: Easy to use, love the creativity

teaser: Its basically a completely digital diary.
description: Diaro is an advanced diary application, but it can be used for keeping a journal or simply writing notes.
pros: It password protects your personal diary entries.
cons: Its limited to writing either a diary or note taking.
summary: To effectively organize your personal thoughts and stories in a diary like platform.

teaser: Offers an online editor with easy version control and collaboration to improve your writing.
description: Offers an online editor with easy version control and collaboration to improve your writing.
pros: Offers an online editor with easy version control and collaboration to improve your writing.
cons: Sign up.
summary: Helps

teaser: Imagine your notes app on your phone expanded to send those notes anywhere on the internet
description: While Drafts can be used as a proper writing app, its best use is for quick entry of your thoughts, to use elsewhere later. Drafts also lets you send text to tons of services and apps. Think of it as the best scratch pad available for writers.
pros: I think that you can send it to facebook, your email, google docs, etc. is very good.
cons: it is 10.00 for just one or two less steps that you could take on your own.
summary: Ever think of something really awesome in the middle of the day but then later that thought has completely escaped. Well this app can help.

teaser: App that types what you say
description: Dragon Dictation is an easy-to-use voice recognition application powered by Dragon® NaturallySpeaking® that allows you to easily speak and instantly see your text or email messages.
pros: It eliminates having to physically write anything.
cons: It wont be effective in loud settings with lots of people
summary: If you hate physically writing but you love talking then you will love this app

teaser: Its a filing cabinet in your pocket.
description: Dropbox is the place for your photos, docs, videos, and other files. Files you keep in Dropbox are safely backed up and you can get to them from all your devices.
pros: Available on all devices
cons: Problems uploading large files
summary: It stores all your information in one place

teaser: A language learning app
description: A free language learning app that rivals paid programs.
pros: Free, high-quality instruction. Translates real-world text & provides clear progress markers. Users are able to test out of lessons that are too easy; students can set reminder notifications.
cons: Only 10 language-learning programs fully supported at this time; because it's largely crowd-sourced, other language programs are in process. No live chat or spoken interaction with other students
summary: It's the only free language-learning program that gets it right.

teaser: It's like a digital language teacher.
description: An app that teaches you different languages
pros: Learning phrases in other languages
cons: Sometimes is off on conjugation
summary: I wanted to learn german to speak to a friend

teaser: It creates your bibliography for you.
description: Generate citations in MLA, APA & Chicago formats for your bibliography
pros: It creates your bibliography with information in the correct order.
cons: APA and chicago format cost money.
summary: Its faster and easier than creating a bibliography yourself.

teaser: cite sources in 30 seconds
description: cites books, movies, websites, music, etc.
pros: all sources are saved on profile
cons: none
summary: easy to use

teaser: Editorial is basically a version of google docs, however, it has a dropbox feature that separates it from google docs.
description: Editorial has robust Dropbox sync, with version support and a healthy workflow community online that can make exporting and even publishing from the app a cinch. Editorial is the perfect combination of a great interface that adapts to your needs. Editorial is professional grade software that's a little expensive, but well worth your money.
pros: The Dropbox feature
cons: It costs money
summary: Innovation opportunity

teaser: Place for teachers to post assignments and send messages to the class
description: There wasn't one. (Edmond Is a place for students and Teachers to connect.)
pros: Free, Easy Access
cons: its by class
summary: If a teacher uses it it's really helpful

teaser: Great educational blog site
description: Easy Blogging for education of all levels
pros: The customization of your personal blog. You have about 200 options as a basic format and then you can go in and change the pictures to be specific to you.
cons: It is hard to categorize things at first
summary: Easy site great for any IB portfolio or process journal as well as just a fun blog.

teaser: Encyclopedia for Mythology
description: The encyclopedia will serve the serious researcher, the student, and the casual reader with equal success. Come in and enjoy!
pros: .org so it is reliable
cons: a little weird to use at first
summary: beneficial for projects needing reliable sources

teaser: It's like a virtual writer that will write essays for you
description: a website that types any type of essay for you.
pros: It is for lazy people
cons: Plagorize
summary: if you try it, be careful

teaser: Its an appp for writing anything from notes, papers to to-do lists
description: Helps you organize your personal and professional projects
pros: Note taking
cons: Not one
summary: Organization

teaser: notes, reminders, check lists
description: notes app but with more features
pros: lots of features like inserting pictures or taking audio notes
cons: paying for premium
summary: its better than the apple notes app

teaser: It helps you know when to use a comma and where
description: BECOME A BETTER WRITER IN MINUTES... NOT YEARS!! ... with this quick, fun and simple reference App! EZCOMMA teaches the correct usage of commas and semicolons for combining sentences, the key to a more developed writing style! This App requires only a minimum of effort because EZCOMMA really is just that: EASY!! EZCOMMA features a quick navigation menu and your teacher: Mr. E. Z. Comma. His words are projected onto the screen as a visual lesson while you enjoy the original music... or mute the sound; it's your choice. The new interactive Review Section can be used as a pre-test and post-test! Present to the world as intelligent as you really are with this free download of EZCOMMA
pros: Easy to use
cons: Long lessons
summary: Everyone needs help with commas :)

teaser: An easy typing and creation app for the blind
description: It is an app to make typing easier for the blind, but also an easy way to make gifs and so forth.
pros: The easy typing keyboard
cons: hard to navigate
summary: Its a good keyboard to use when you are typing on your phone

teaser: Games to help grammar
description: play games to help with grammar
pros: free, kid friendly
cons: only for kids
summary: great grammar practice

teaser: Just a fun website to draw
description: Tons of Colors, tools, and shapes
pros: Fun and Free
cons: Not really educational
summary: Fun when you're bored

teaser: Games to teach people English!
description: Games for English Practice
pros: Free, Great for kids!
cons: No Advance levels :(
summary: Super Fun !

teaser: Poster board online
description: Just drag-and-drop shapes from an extensive library and point-and-click your way to format. No expertise needed.
pros: Collaboration, "lightning fast", and you can save progress and go back.
cons: There aren't a whole lot of colors to choose from (important for mapping, memorization, etc.
summary: Fun way to work

teaser: Make Diagramming a Team Sport
description: Achieve visual consistency with custom templates, logos and shape libraries your entire team can create, edit and share.
pros: Many popular companies have used it and enjoyed it
cons: You have to pay for certain features
summary: Collaborate on flowcharts, org charts, UML, network diagrams & more.

teaser: Easy way to keep your best ideas flowing
description: gliffy is a brainstorming website that creates a diagram for your best ideas and saves them through the website so that you do not forget. It is helpful because you can add in notes along with the main ideas for your brainstorming diagram.
pros: The notes option so you can remember every detail of the idea.
cons: It is not super cool looking. It is helpful but if you are a " The more the better" this is not the website
summary: It is a great way to remember every detail of your ideas

teaser: An app that helps you self edit your work in an organized manner.
description: All you have to do is save your manuscript as a PDF. Then you can go nuts marking up your draft using sticky notes, highlighting text, inserting edits, or all of the above. It's also super easy to import, sync, and manage your files.
pros: The variety of sticky notes, inserting edits, and highlighting text.
cons: I am not sure its effective in collaborating and sharing work with others on a separate device.
summary: To be able to have an organized and digitally saved edit of all of your works

teaser: Online book club social media deal thingy
description: Share Book Recommendations With Your Friends, Join Book Club, Answer Trivia
pros: keep track of what books you've read

teaser: Best Technological Grammar Teacher
description: Your friendly guide to the world of grammar, punctuation, usage, and fun developments in the English language. - See more at: http://www.quickanddirtytips.com/grammar-girl#sthash.v37CF9rX.dpuf
pros: Easy to use search bar
cons: none really.
summary: Easy to use, and understand

teaser: The best grammar tool
description: Automatically checks for grammar and spelling errors
pros: Works on google docs, email, word, and almost everything else
cons: Sometimes has annoying alerts

teaser: Writing for Dummies
description: Select a grammar or writing topic and read a excerpt with definitions and tons of examples.
pros: Easy tabs to open to select forms of writing
cons: a little difficult to figure out at first

teaser: Fun way to be motivated if you like the typewriter sound.
description: Actor Tom Hanks and Hitcents have partnered on a new app, Hanx Writer, that recreates the experience of a manual typewriter, but with the ease and speed of an iPad.
pros: The similarity to a typewriter, but the accessibility of an iPhone
cons: you can't delete
summary: its fun

teaser: It's like have Ernest Hemingway in your living room.
description: The app highlights long, complex sentences and common errors
pros: Hemingway App makes your writing bold and clear.
cons: I didn't see any reviews on it
summary: It's your own personal editor.

teaser: It's like having an English teacher tell you if your writing is not good enough
description: Hemingway makes your writing bold and clear. It's like a spellchecker, but for style. It makes sure that your reader will focus on your message, not your prose.
pros: It highlights passive voice so you can change it to active voice.
cons: It marks almost every sentence as "too long."
summary: It makes you feel productive to have something ~official~ check your writing.
comments: It only has fees if you buy the desktop version instead of using the website. Also, not compatible on iPhones.

teaser: Basically an App that serves the purpose of an index card.
description: It's literally a little cork board, specifically designed for touch screens so that you can touch and drag each one of your color-coordinated note cards.
pros: Its perfect for writing down ideas you suddenly get in situations where you would normally have nothing to write with.
cons: It is basically the same thing as the iphone notes.
summary: Its a good app for organizing your work how you want it to be organized.

teaser: Custom concept map
description: Your friendly guide to the world of grammar, punctuation, usage, and fun developments in the English language.
pros: you can search for concept maps
cons: none really

description: Fast, personal feedback on student work Quickly give every student the feedback they need to improve, for free.
pros: audio on google docs might help kids understand comments better than written

summary: change it up

teaser: Very Similar to edublogs but directed toward younger audiences
description: Let your class explore and post with Kidblog, this website is perfect for individual assignments and preparations for keeping up with assignments.
pros: It is formatted easily.
cons: It is very simple, geared toward younger audiences.
summary: This is great for a middle school or freshman class.

teaser: Brainstorming website with a fun format
description: sticky and photo sharing for you.
pros: It is a fun format that grabs your attention.
cons: It is pretty basic.
summary: It is a good useful website.

teaser: Lists of ideas for creative writing
description: Literally the title describes it best
pros: good ideas
cons: Hard to navigate
summary: Helps come up with ideas that you wouldn't be able to think of on your own

teaser: It's an unlimited resource of reading
description: Lit2Go is a free online collection of stories and poems in Mp3 (audiobook) format. An abstract, citation, playing time, and word count are given for each of the passages. Many of the passages also have a related reading strategy identified. Each reading passage can also be downloaded as a PDF and printed for use as a read-along or as supplemental reading material for your classroom
pros: You can download and share with other people, like for other students.
cons: Some of the books you are looking for may not be available due to copyright.
summary: It's an easy way to read popular books and find new works as well.

teaser: reviews from kids who read the books!
description:
Book reviews and books helped LitPick grow
...and now see us all grown up into a free online reading and writing program.
Our online interactive reading program movie
Please read more about our free interactive reading and writing strategy, see some of our sample book reviews, and learn how you can read and review books online for free (...that is, if you are still a student) or even become a LitPick member (...for giveaways, student book recommendations, & more).

Happy LitPicking!                                                                                              
Gary (the dad)
pros: free reviews for SO MANY BOOKS!!!!
cons: doesn't have reviews for big-movie made books (Divergent, etc.)
summary: free, easy website for reviews written by kids

teaser: Simple online French dictionary
description: This is the French - English version of our Picture Dictionary with links.
pros: easy to use
cons: looks like it was made in 2003
summary: if you need a quick easy french word this is the way to go

teaser: Fun way to learn Geography!
description: Welcome to ETC's collection of historic maps. Here you will find over 5,000 maps representing many different time periods. A friendly license allows teachers and students to use up to 25 maps in non-commercial school projects without further permission. All maps are available as GIF or JPEG files for screen display as well as in PDF for printing. Use the GIF or JPEG maps for classroom presentations and student websites. Use the PDF maps for displays, bulletin boards, and printed school reports.
pros: so many different kinds of maps
cons: TOO many different kinds of maps.
summary: if you need a map, well...

teaser: table for organization and stuff
description: layout your data
pros: organized
cons: you have to learn how to use it
summary: its better than writing everything

teaser: writing documents
description: writing

cons: east to lose stuff

teaser: Want to diagram your ideas? this is the site for you.
description: This site allows you to brainstorm ideas around a central topic. For example, I brainstormed around my main focus topic which was  Winter Break, then after that you can create sub topics and relate them back to each other or the main focus.
pros: This website could be great for creating an outline for a film script or a book. The ability to relate subtopics back to one another would create a good way to reference back to small details that you would forget if just brainstorming through conversation.
cons: On the surface it seems simple and pointless. It is something that you could do on your own with pen and paper. However, it erases the risk of loosing that paper because it is on an online and savable format.
summary: It is a great way to document your brainstorming.

teaser: A template for brainstorming that neatly keeps all your ideas together.
description: This app will let you organize all those brilliant ideas in an easy-to-follow, intuitively laid out format.
pros: The layout effectively keeps even the most random thoughts together.
cons: You cant use the app on a computer.
summary: This app is perfect for the unorganized writer.

teaser: A special font helpful to people with Dyslexia
description: Letters have heavy weighted bottoms to indicate direction. This aids in recognizing the correct letter, and sometimes keeps the brain from rotating them.
pros: Makes text easier to read
cons: Adds an extra step, as you may have to change the font for some items you are wanting to read.
summary: Simple extra step is a small price to pay, especially since this feature is free!

teaser: It is an awesome format to communicate with your community.
description: Lets be realistic, facebook is out of style, twitter is a little too short, and Instagram simply wouldn't work as a mobile hangout for your community. Love to go hiking or paddle boarding? Create a mobile community on Padlet. Your padlet can extend as small as a group of locals or an entire city or state wide group. This website allows you to share information and communicate with people who shares the same interests as you.
pros: It is more customization than Facebook, very similar to myspace in your individual profile customization.
cons: It is pretty much a glorified facebook, however. Like it said in the description facebook is out dated for a lot of people.
summary: It is a good way to share a common interest with a large group of people.

types: an app for your mac ipad or iphone
teaser: Microsoft Word for a mac
description: Pages for Mac is a powerful word processor that gives you everything you need to create documents that look beautiful. And read beautifully. Redesigned for OS X El Capitan, it lets you work seamlessly between Mac and iOS devices. And even work effortlessly with people who use Microsoft Word.
pros: works great with your mac

teaser: notes on phone
description: notes

teaser: This site is perfect for the novice writer or anyone who wants to increase their knowledge of basic grammar. An author is able to transfer a piece of content from their computer to the site and have it graded for content and grammar. Although many experienced writers no longer need a tool such as Paper Rater, the site is great for anyone who is new at the writing game or anyone who needs a free proof reader and editor for their content.
description: This site is perfect for the novice writer or anyone who wants to increase their knowledge of basic grammar. An author is able to transfer a piece of content from their computer to the site and have it graded for content and grammar. Although many experienced writers no longer need a tool such as Paper Rater, the site is great for anyone who is new at the writing game or anyone who needs a free proof reader and editor for their content.
pros: This site is perfect for the novice writer or anyone who wants to increase their knowledge of basic grammar. summary: This helps break repeating phrases to make a paper longer

teaser: Fun Game to brainstorm ideas
description: Pinball is a game that is run through BBC's website. It is an easy and fun way to brainstorm your ideas. There are several tabs around the outside of the  Pinball machine and then you can click on them. Type in your idea and then from that the game will provide other potential ideas and feedback for you to take in.
pros: It is fun and easy.
cons: When I first went to play it it said the content was unavailable I had to refresh the page several times for it to work.
summary: Brainstorming without a friend can be hard but with pinball it is easy and fun.

teaser: You can rhyme anytime
description: Poetreat is a poetry editor that suggests rhymes as you write. Get the best available rhymes and syllable count as you type.
pros: Can help if you're having writer's block

teaser: Like PowerPoint and Cartoons put together
description: Create animated videos and presentations
pros: You can post the videos on Youtube
cons: Its costs money for each month
summary: Its very very cool. Its unique from other presentation programs.

teaser: The ultimate resource for writing
description: These OWL resources will help you with the writing process: pre-writing (invention), developing research questions and outlines, composing thesis statements, and proofreading. While the writing process may be different for each person and for each particular assignment, the resources contained in this section follow the general work flow of pre-writing, organizing, and revising.
pros: It can help with any kind of writing
cons: Didn't find any
summary: It teaches the mechanics of writing and provides the tools we need to be successful

teaser: Rockband for free
description: A large archive royalty free music for any of your projects.
pros: It is free.
cons: The website is a little annoying to navigate.
summary: This is an easy way to download music to put over simple projects.

teaser: It is a digital personal advisore for your writing
description: It’s difficult for anyone to write when they are distracted. Luckily Q10 is there to minimize distractions and help to increase writing potential. This downloadable software is a full screen environment with all kinds of goodies to help you along. This app remembers what you worked on last and will automatically open it at start up. It also has a timer that you can set to remind you to take a bit of a break; you can even set a word count goal for yourself. One of the best elements of this software is the automatic save. You never have to worry about remembering to save your document while you write, because you can have Q10 save your work by the minute or by paragraphs written.
pros: The ability to set a timer, a lot of times when I write I get burnt out on my writing and get stuck into a state of rambling and forgetting what I have written previous ly. Q10 allows you to set a timer so you can take well needed breaks.
cons: It is not as glamorous as the description makes it out to be
summary: It can help you better manage your time when writing to get the best possible output.

teaser: Flashcards on your phone
description: The best study tools should work for any curriculum, any level user, any teacher or student, anywhere in the world.
pros: Most love the game feature of it where you can learn and do a puzzle at the same time.
cons: Most give very high reviews, bad reviews come from app functionality which have been fixed with updates.
summary: The flashcards, tests, and study games make it fun to learn anything.

teaser: The perfect study tool
description: Quizlet's flashcards, tests, and study games make it fun to learn anything.
pros: Subscribe to profiles
cons: sometimes difficult to find class
summary: Easy, your own study guide

teaser: It's like a bar code scanner and easybib put together!
description: The free tool to create citations, reference lists and bibliographies in any format.
pros: No information has to be entered, everything is automatic. The bar code scanner
cons: some of the books have to be entered manually
summary: Its very easy to use and you can automatically copy and paste it whatever you are working on if you have the google drive app on your phone.

teaser: It is a digital organizer that keeps all of your ideas stored conveniently on your laptop.
description: Scrivener puts everything you need for structuring, writing and editing long documents at your fingertips.
pros: Scrivener lets you work in any order you want and gives you tools for planning and restructuring your writing.
cons: Its basically a more complex version of Microsoft Word
summary: To spur creativity in your writing with its alternative writing formats.

teaser: Its like an app were you can annotate pictures or articles more easily
description: It lets you annotate, mark up maps, add captions to anything
pros: Lets you upload pictures fast and easy
cons: not one
summary: It makes things simple when posting pictures or making captions

teaser: Online library meets morning announcements
description: Centrally located in the school, the SMMHS library serves the entire middle and high school population with one full-time librarian.  The library physical space includes a main area for group instruction, a small area for the desktops, the circulation desk, and the shelves holding our collections.  Additionally, there are two offices: one is the office of our head librarian, and the other is our school's gifted coordinator.  We have two labs; one is used full-time as a computer lab, the other is our school's Learning Center where students come for tutoring.  The Learning Center is funded through MEF. Additionally, we have two large storage closets: one holds our general storage materials, and the other is our a/v closet.  This unit is particularly large, so it is also the home of our school bookstore, as it has a door that opens out to the hallway.  Another room in the library is used as ISS; it is in the back corner of the library.
pros: all of the useful tools with links RIGHT THERE
cons: too many drop down menus to look through
summary: you have to:)

teaser: Great way to make sure you really understand
description: Provides notes in any subject area
pros: There are so many notes for you to borrow
cons: might be tempted to not actually read their books
summary: you need it

teaser: Its a concept map
description:
Capture, connect and share ideas easily!
SpiderScribe is an online mind mapping and brainstorming tool. It lets you organize your ideas by connecting notes, files, calendar events, etc. in free-form maps. You can collaborate and share those maps online!
pros: sharing and collaborating online
cons: none
summary: keep all your ideas in one place

teaser: Its like words with friends mixed with trivia crack
description: It is a game you play against a friend. You have 5 categories and 1 letter. You have to name words that fit each category but it has to start with that letter. You have a limited time to fill out each category.
pros: fun
cons: The loosing part
summary: It is fun and may help increase your vocabulary

teaser: Words With Friends meets Trivia Crack
description: Fun Fast word game to keep you on your toes.
pros: Fun way to learn.
cons: Time Limit
summary: STOP! and get stop.

teaser: It is digital platform to help manage your story, outline, chapters, notes, etc.
description: When writing a complex story with multiple plot lines, you may need a little help keeping track of all that is going on. Storybook will be there to help you through the process of writing your book by helping you to keep track of your overview. Basic Storybook has four views to help you, along with other useful tools incorporated in those views. The four views are Chronological View, Manage Chapters and Scenes View, Book View, and Reading View.
pros: The fact that you can access it on several different platforms
cons: It could have more features
summary: Helps you organize your story
tutorial_urls: The site did not provide one

teaser: A digital library of peer written short stories, novels, etc.
description: Write, read, discover, and share. This is a digital library filled with peer written material for your enjoyment
pros: It is broad and have lots of features. It is basically a social network completely centered on writing.
cons: There is a lot of fan fiction and sometimes it is weird
summary: If you wanna share your work but dont have the motivation to go and get it published try Storybird

teaser: Its a combination of an agenda mate, calendar, and alarm
description: Sometimes you forget to turn your phone off during classes, and that’s exactly when your parents decide to call you. This Android app will help you avoid interrupting the class and getting on the professor’s nerves.
pros: Most people like how it can keep all of your assignments in one place and helps remind you when you have any upcoming quizzes and tests. I thought this app would be cool because it would make your phone less of a distraction.
cons: Some people had navigational and user issues, but those could be easily fixed with updates.
summary: No more interruptions while you're working
comments: I know this app does not have to do with writing, but I just thought it was a cool idea for an app. I said that teachers could use it too because many teacher's phones go off during class as well or they could use it as a planner.

teaser: It's learning that works for everyone and everywhere
description: Study Island’s high-impact, high-value K-12 learning programs provide proven academic support through practice, immediate feedback, and built-in remediation to improve students’ performance in core skill areas. Paired with an intuitive, real-time data dashboard, educators can easily track student progress and differentiate instruction to continually drive student achievement.
pros: It has games for kids so they can learn while they play
cons: Some people might not like using the computer as much as on paper
summary: It is a fun way to learn for all ages

teaser: A host of videos on every subject imaginable (including writing)
description: Lessons worth sharing
pros: The videos are cute and informative
cons: Sometimes it's hard to pay attention for a video if it's not very engaging.
summary: Entertaining, educational videos.

teaser: It's a central place for all your ideas
description: Mind maps are a great way of organizing your thoughts. To encourage the use of mind mapping, Text 2 Mind Map has provided a free and simple mind mapping tool
pros: You can have endless branches of ideas off of one topic
cons: You have to pay for certain features
summary: You can use Text2MindMap for all your projects, it is perfect for keeping focused on what's important.

teaser: It is a simple app that helps you brain storm ideas through a random algorithm that combines ideas and plots you get to choose from.
description: You just spin the wheel to randomly combine a plot, a subject, and a setting or style. Either use the included wheels, or edit the wheels to build entirely new scenarios (like with your own characters and settings).
pros: It will most definitely help writers that easily get stuck or hit a wall when writing.
cons: Some writers may feel like using this app is cheating or inauthentic.
summary: To help brainstorm ideas for a story once you have a vague idea of what it is you want to write about.

teaser: All presidential candidate campaign commercials from 1952-2012
description: Museum of the moving image:  Presidential Campaign Commercials 1952-2012
pros: See how candidates went head to head over the past 50 years
cons: N/A
summary: If you're doing a project on presidents or campaigns, this is a good resource for you

pros: Free, Super Easy

description: Online thesaurus

summary: You can find words that sound better for your writing.

Access the site wherever you are and on any computer.
Build your own library of interactive learning resources.
Join groups and share activities with colleagues

teaser: Its a combination of an agenda mate, calendar, and alarm
description: Improve Student Writing with Instant Feedback as They Revise
pros: checks for plagiarism
cons: using paper is easier
summary: turn stuff in online

teaser: Ultimate focus writing tool with built in library for your own works.
description: Ulysses for Mac lets you focus when you need to concentrate. It keeps all your texts neatly stuffed in its intuitive library. With a few clicks, Ulysses can create beautiful documents from your manuscripts: PDFs, web pages, even iBooks-ready ePubs. With its simple, clutter-free interface, it will turn work hours into fun time. And mere thoughts into powerful stories. If you love to write, and write a lot, Ulysses is made for you.
pros: diverse in the types of documents you can make.
cons: Expensive
summary: Very simple, no distractions

teaser: best for a large amount of references
description: Visual Einstein is free downloadable software that can be useful for all types of people. This application helps you to organize your writing project by using notes, headings, hyperlinks, and subheadings. Visual Einstein is most helpful when you have a lot of reference information.
pros: organization of references
cons: none
summary: if you like googledocs you will love visual Einstein

teaser: Automated powerpoint
description:
Manage Students
Add and manage your students. Assign students to one or more classes and give them each a unique login. There's no need for students to register! 
Manage Classes & Lessons
Add and manage classes and lessons. Customize the appearance and instructions of each lesson. Students can easily view and complete their Voki assignments from the Student view. 
Review Vokis
Easily review your students' Voki assignments in one place. Review and approve all students Vokis by lesson, or by student.
pros: good for multi tasking
cons: does not really seem necessary
summary: nervous about presenting? Have your avatar do it for you!

teaser: A place for people to post their writings and read others work
description: Wattpad has all the stories you need, and we make it easy to read—right on your phone. Whether you're online or offline, you can read seamlessly without worrying about downloading PDFs.
pros: Free, Easy to Use
cons: Nothing
summary: Anyone can use!

teaser: werdsmith turns your advice into a portable writing studio

teaser: When you're too lazy to type with two hands

teaser: Paste your paper into the box and it tells you how many times each word is repeated.
